title: Free-by-cyclic groups are equationally Noetherian
abstract:
A group $G$ is said to be equationally Noetherian if every system of
equations in $G$ is equivalent to a finite subsystem. We show that all
free-by-cyclic groups are equationally Noetherian. As a corollary, we deduce
that the set of exponential growth rates of a free-by-cyclic group is well
ordered. Along the way, we prove that free-by-cyclic groups with polynomially
growing monodromies of infinite order admit non-elementary 4-acylindrical
actions on trees. We show that the splittings arising from the improved
relative train track machinery of Bestvina-Feighn-Handel are 2-acylindrical
when the growth is at least quadratic.
